decks.notes: This deck focuses on controlling the game by utilizing lands to disrupt the opponent's strategy while setting up a powerful win condition with Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage. It utilizes cards like Crop Rotation and Exploration to quickly assemble the combo, while also using disruptive elements like Wasteland and Ghost Quarter to hinder the opponent's mana base. The deck also includes cards like Boseiju, Who Endures and Malevolent Rumble to protect its key pieces and disrupt the opponent's spells, creating a strong control and combo strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to disrupt your opponent's resources through a combination of land destruction, hand disruption, and creature removal. You aim to control the game by using cards like Smallpox, Thoughtseize, and Wasteland to disrupt your opponent's game plan and gain advantage. Additionally, utilizing cards like Liliana of the Veil and Sheoldred's Edict helps you maintain board control. With powerful late-game threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Baloth Prime, you aim to close out the game once you have successfully disrupted your opponent's strategy.

The main strategy of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, allowing the player to play powerful Eldrazi creatures like Thought-Knot Seer and Reality Smasher ahead of schedule. Chalice of the Void helps shut down opposing strategies, while cards like Wasteland and Wastescape Battlemage disrupt the opponent's land base. By overwhelming the opponent with fast, powerful threats, this deck aims to win the game before the opponent can establish their own game plan.

This deck focuses on using low-cost creatures like Ornithopter and Changeling Outcast to quickly swarm the board and apply pressure to the opponent. The deck also utilizes ninjutsu abilities from cards like Yuriko, the Tiger's Shadow and Ingenious Infiltrator to evade blockers and deal damage directly to the opponent. It includes control elements like Fatal Push, Daze, and Force of Will to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck has a strong mana base with fetch lands and dual lands to ensure consistent casting of spells. The key strategy is to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive creatures and efficient card advantage.

The main concept of this Legacy Death & Taxes aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Karakas, Ghost Quarter, and Wasteland while applying pressure with efficient creatures like Stoneforge Mystic, Flickerwisp, and Skyclave Apparition. The deck aims to control the battlefield with removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Solitude, and utilize Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play. The inclusion of equipment like Umezawa's Jitte and efficient creatures with strong abilities like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and Witch Enchanter enhances the deck's aggressive strategy.

The deck focuses on accelerating mana and efficiently using various protection and disruption spells to enable fast and powerful plays, ultimately aiming to win the game through a Natural Order combo, often fetching Progenitus or Atraxa, Grand Unifier. It also utilizes versatile creatures like Hexdrinker, Ice-Fang Coatl, and Endurance to control the board and apply pressure on the opponent. The inclusion of cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath provides additional card advantage and versatility, making the deck a formidable opponent in the Legacy format.

Utilize a mix of efficient removal, disruptive counter magic, and powerful threats to disrupt the opponent's game plan while applying pressure and controlling the tempo of the game. Efficiently deploy threats like Murktide Regent and Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student to quickly close out the game while disrupting the opponent with cards like Thoughtseize and Daze. Use fetch lands to thin the deck and trigger cards like Barrowgoyf and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares. Mana denial with cards like Wasteland and Orcish Bowmasters can also create tempo advantages.

The main concept of the deck is to quickly disrupt and control the opponent's plays with powerful disruptive cards like Chalice of the Void, Blood Moon, and Trinisphere while utilizing fast mana sources like Chrome Mox and Simian Spirit Guide. The deck aims to quickly deploy aggressive threats like Broadside Bombardiers and Pyrogoyf, supported by cards like Sundering Eruption and Fury to close out the game quickly. The inclusion of cards like Magus of the Moon and Blood Sun further hinders the opponent's ability to play their spells effectively, creating a challenging board state for them to navigate.

This deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a fast and aggressive strategy, utilizing a mix of disruptive spells like Thoughtseize and Fatal Push, along with efficient creatures like Orcish Bowmasters and Murktide Regent. The deck also utilizes versatile cards like Tamiyo, Inquisitive Student and Brazen Borrower to control the board and maintain pressure. With a solid mana base and powerful spells like Force of Will, this Grixis Aggro deck can quickly take control of the game and close out matches before the opponent has a chance to stabilize.

The main concept of this deck is to quickly and efficiently play out an entire hand of spells without any lands, focusing on a powerful combo strategy to win the game in one explosive turn. This combo relies on cards like Lotus Petal, Dark Ritual, and Simian Spirit Guide to generate mana, as well as cards like Cabal Therapy and Unmask to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The deck also includes graveyard recursion with cards like Thassa's Oracle and Dread Return to help secure the win condition.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to disrupt the opponent's gameplan by locking them out of playing their spells with Chalice of the Void and using powerful Eldrazi creatures to quickly overwhelm them. The deck focuses on playing high-impact threats like Thought-Knot Seer and Eldrazi Linebreaker early in the game, supported by fast mana sources like Lotus Petal and Simian Spirit Guide. The inclusion of powerful lands like Cavern of Souls and Ancient Tomb further reinforces the deck's aggressive strategy, making it difficult for opponents to keep up with its relentless pressure.

The deck focuses on using lands as both a resource and a win condition, utilizing cards like Dark Depths and Thespian's Stage to create a powerful 20/20 Marit Lage token. It also uses cards like Wasteland and Bojuka Bog to disrupt opponent's strategies. The deck features powerful control elements such as The Tabernacle at Pendrell Vale and Boseiju, Who Endures to protect its key pieces. By utilizing cards like Exploration and Crop Rotation, the deck can quickly assemble its land combinations and overwhelm opponents with its powerful land-based threats.

This Merfolk deck focuses on quickly overwhelming the opponent with a swarm of sea creatures, using the synergy of Lord of Atlantis and Master of the Pearl Trident to pump up the team. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Merfolk Trickster and Sink into Stupor to control the board and protect its key creatures like True-Name Nemesis. With a strong mana base and protection from counterspells with Force of Will, this aggro deck aims to rush down the opponent and win through aggressive attacks and strategic disruption.

The main concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly ramp into powerful Eldrazi creatures such as It That Heralds the End, Thought-Knot Seer, and Reality Smasher using mana acceleration cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb. Chalice of the Void is used to disrupt opponents' spells, while Wasteland helps control opponents' mana resources. The deck aims to apply early pressure and overwhelm opponents with large, efficient creatures, taking advantage of the tribal synergy and colorless mana support from cards like Cavern of Souls and Unclaimed Territory.

The deck is focused on aggressive strategies that aim to quickly deal damage to the opponent using burn spells and fast creatures such as Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with direct damage and pressure, utilizing cards like Lightning Bolt, Chain Lightning, Eidolon of the Great Revel, and Price of Progress to control the board and finish off the opponent quickly. The inclusion of cards like Roiling Vortex and Fireblast further adds to the deck's ability to consistently apply pressure and end the game before the opponent can stabilize.

This deck aims to quickly ramp up mana with cards like Lotus Petal and Ancient Tomb, allowing the player to cast powerful spells like Show and Tell to cheat out game-ending threats like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn, Archon of Cruelty, and Griselbrand. Using cards like Parker Luck and Stock Up to dig for combo pieces and protect the combo with Force of Will, the deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with powerful creatures and game-changing abilities before they can react effectively.
